sentence: As shown in the top right panel of Figure 1, individuals who, on average, experienced higher negative affect in the morning also tended to experience more intense smoking urges later in the day ().

Similarly, as shown in the top left panel of Figure 1, on mornings when individuals’ negative affect was higher than usual, their smoking urges later in the day also tended to be more intense than usual ().

The results also showed that participants differed substantially from one another in the extent of within-person association between morning negative affect and later day smoking urges, indicated by the light gray lines in the top left panel of Figure 1 ().
Logistic model results are reported in log odds units.Figure 1.
In contrast, as shown in the bottom left panel of Figure 1, there was a credible within-person association between morning negative affect and later-day smoking ().
This is visually depicted by the faint gray lines in the bottom left panel of Figure 1.
As shown in the top right panel of Figure 2, individuals who, on average, experienced higher positive affect in the morning also tended to experience less intense smoking urges later in the day ().

Similarly, as shown in the top left panel of Figure 2, on mornings when individuals’ positive affect was higher than usual, their smoking urges later in the day tended to be less intense than usual ().

The results also showed that participants differed substantially from one another in the extent of within-person association between morning positive affect and later day smoking urges, indicated by the light gray lines in the top left panel of Figure 2 ().
Logistic model results are reported in log odds units.Figure 2.
This is visually depicted by the faint gray lines in the top left panel of Figure 2.

As shown in Figure 1 and Figure 4, with all other parameters held identical, a higher random-effect SD resulted in a lower power for both the within- and between-person effects in both the linear and logistic models we investigated.
However, as shown in Figure 2, the influence of the fixed effect intercept was found to be more salient in the small random-effect SD condition.
Finally, Figure 3 and Figure 5 show that the effect of varying the correlation between random effects on power was found to be minimal in both of the models.
As shown in the top right panel of Figure 1, individuals who, on average, experienced higher negative affect in the morning also tended to experience more intense smoking urges later in the day ().

Similarly, as shown in the top left panel of Figure 1, on mornings when individuals’ negative affect was higher than usual, their smoking urges later in the day also tended to be more intense than usual ().

The results also showed that participants differed substantially from one another in the extent of within-person association between morning negative affect and later day smoking urges, indicated by the light gray lines in the top left panel of Figure 1 ().
Logistic model results are reported in log odds units.Figure 1.

The results also showed that participants differed substantially from one another in the extent of within-person association between morning positive affect and later day smoking urges, indicated by the light gray lines in the top left panel of Figure 2 ().
Logistic model results are reported in log odds units.Figure 2.
